Program

Class DiskUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • Program.DiskUnit

  • public class DiskUnit
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Jariel Class that contains the implementation of a physical disk

    • Method Detail

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Read the first nibble of the storage and gets the capacity
        Returns:
        capacity(number of blocks on the storage area)

      • getBlockSize

        public int getBlockSize()
        Get the size of each block that belongs to the Disk by reading the second nibble of the storage area
        Returns:
        blocksize

      • write

        public void write(int blockNum,
                  VirtualDiskBlock b)
           throws InvalidBlockNumberException,
                  InvalidBlockException
        write the data that belongs to the virtual block on the physical storage area
        Parameters:
        blockNum - -block of the physical storage where the data of the virtual block is wanted to be written
        b - -virtual block that contains the data which is wanted to be written
        Throws:
        InvalidBlockNumberException - -thrown whenever the block number received is not valid for the current disk instance
        InvalidBlockException - -thrown whenever b does not represent a valid disk block for the current disk instance

      • read

        public void read(int blockNum,
                 VirtualDiskBlock b)
          throws InvalidBlockNumberException,
                 InvalidBlockException
        read the data on the physical storage, and copy it to the virtual block given
        Parameters:
        blockNum - -block of the physical storage where the data is wanted to be read
        b - -virtual block where the data read is copied
        Throws:
        InvalidBlockNumberException - -thrown whenever the block number received is not valid for the current disk instance
        InvalidBlockException - -thrown whenever b does not represent a valid disk block for the current disk instance

      • lowLevelFormat

        public void lowLevelFormat()
        Low level format just empty the positions on the disk unit going block by block initializing with zero the bytes on each block

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Simulates the process of turning of a disk unit

      • mount

        public static DiskUnit mount(java.lang.String name)
                      throws NonExistingDiskException
        Turns on an existing disk unit.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the disk unit to activate
        Returns:
        the corresponding DiskUnit object
        Throws:
        NonExistingDiskException - whenever no ¨disk¨ with the specified name is found.

      • createDiskUnit

        public static void createDiskUnit(java.lang.String name,
                                  int capacity,
                                  int blockSize)
                           throws ExistingDiskException,
                                  java.security.InvalidParameterException
        Creates a new disk unit with the given name. The disk is formatted as with the specified capacity (number of blocks), each of specified size (number of bytes). The created disk is left as in off mode.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file that is to represent the disk.
        capacity - number of blocks in the new disk
        blockSize - size per block in the new disk
        Throws:
        ExistingDiskException - whenever the name attempted is already in use.
        java.security.InvalidParameterException - whenever the values for capacity or blockSize are not valid according to the specifications

      • createDiskUnit

        public static void createDiskUnit(java.lang.String name)
                           throws ExistingDiskException
        Creates a new disk unit with the given name. The disk is formatted as having default capacity (number of blocks), each of default size (number of bytes). Those values are: DEFAULT_CAPACITY and DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE. The created disk is left as in off mode.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file that is to represent the disk.
        Throws:
        ExistingDiskException - whenever the name attempted is already in use.
